articles.title: Even at 1-8, Boston College football shows signs of life, even in loss to nationally-ranked Notre Dame
articles.description:
Looking at the Boston College football team’s dreadful 1-8 start from afar, one might incorrectly assume that the Eagles have taken a beating every single week. While games against Pittsburgh and Clemson were massacres, they were outliers in a season where BC has come tantalizingly close so many times yet has been unable to seize […]

The post Even at 1-8, Boston College football shows signs of life, even in loss to nationally-ranked Notre Dame appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston College football falls to 1-8 after a close loss to Notre Dame.
Eagles showed improvement despite losses, competing well against ranked teams.
Local fans remain hopeful for future games as team develops resilience.

articles.title: BC’s Donald Hand Jr. looks to step up, UMass enters the MAC, and other men’s college basketball storylines to watch
articles.description:
Boston College guard Donald Hand Jr. was still relatively unknown and unproven prior to last year. He knew deep down he was capable of more, and he vowed to show the world when he got the opportunity. This season, with an Atlantic Coast Conference most improved player award on his resume, Hand Jr. won’t be […]

summary: Boston College's Donald Hand Jr. aims to build on his ACC Most Improved Player award this season.

Local fans can expect increased competition and excitement in college basketball this year.

articles.title: ‘Unaffordable and nearly unlivable’: What readers want Mayor Wu and City Councilors to prioritize
articles.description:
